ai.summary: A scenic 4 km easy hike on the Grey Trail at Dunwich Heath, UK. A family-friendly loop through open heathland with distant sea views and birdlife.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating grassy and gravel paths across open heath. Expect sandy patches and occasional wet ground after rain; sturdy footwear and a light layer are advisable.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and coastal conditions before hiking; winds and fog can reduce visibility. Stay on marked paths to protect delicate heathland and wildlife. Wear sturdy shoes and bring a waterproof jacket. The 4 km route can take 1.5–2 hours at a relaxed pace; daylight hours vary by season. If near the coast, be mindful of tides and soft sand; carry water, a map or GPS, and a charged phone, and let someone know your planned return time.
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (April–October) for mild weather and better trail conditions; winter visits are more likely to be windy, cold and muddy.

seo.title: Grey Trail, Dunwich Heath – 4 km Easy Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 4 km Grey Trail at Dunwich Heath, UK. An easy, family-friendly hike through open heathland with practical safety tips and gear recommendations.
